summary: Complimentary survival mod for use alongside basic needs mods such as Realistic Needs and Diseases. Increases difficulty by removing most food and drinks from the game. You have been warned!
descriptionHtml:
[center][url=http://www.skyrimgems.com][img]http://i.imgur.com/1wXSO.png[/img][/url][/center]



This mod is also featured in [url=http://wiki.step-project.com/Pack:Modular_Morrowloot_Overhaul]Modular Morrowloot Overhaul[/url] and [url=http://wiki.step-project.com/User:Bur/MIME:Guide]Minimal Immersive Morrowloot Explorer's Guide[/url]


-This mod has 3 goals, increase the difficulty of basic needs mods such as [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/26228/?]Realistic Needs and Diseases[/url] and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51473/?]iNeed - Food Water and Sleep[/url], decrease the Skyrim food and wine epidemic to a reasonable level, and increase performance.

[color=red][size=150]YOU CAN NOW ACTUALLY STARVE TO DEATH[/size][/color]

-Lonely Joe in his Cabin won't be able to provide you with a week's worth of food, probably nothing. If you want any food, your going to have to loot wealthy individuals, businesses, and institutions of law or prestige, purchase some from inns and vendors, or go hunting some wabbits. If you can't find enough to eat, then too bad.


[color=red][size=150](Jessie Pinkman's favorite word), ITS IMMERSIVE!!!![/size][/color]


-Based on the population of a cell (interior/exterior), there may be a greater or worse quantity and selection of foods and drinks scattered in an area. 
-Food types available in locations are based on the presence of nearby crops, the environment (forest, river, ocean, snow), the wealth of the individuals, and lore.
-Non disabled foods/drinks are located in more logical and harder to reach/steal places.


[color=#ff0000][size=150]THE GRASS IS GREENER...NEXT TO THAT BROWN PATCH (Introduced in V2)[/size]

[/color]
-Different locations influence the scaling of food and drink availability; a jarl's palace will naturally have much more excess sustenance than an inn, and an ancient ruin will always have nothing. There are 11 area modifiers with Food and Drink Ratings ranging from 0-4, which determine the quantity and quality of the foods and drinks available. 

[color=#00ff00]1. Dungeons[/color]
[b]Food Rating: 0
Drink Rating: 0
Includes: Ruins, Mines, Abandoned Forts, and Caves (with creatures)[/b]

Until recently, these forgotten dwellings have been abandoned and left with foul creatures. You will find nothing here.


[color=#00ff00]2. Bandit Camps[/color]
[b]Food Rating: 0
Drink Rating: 0.5
Includes: Anywhere with Bandits[/b]

Besides being cut off from the rest of civilization, bandits are extremely poor and must live off the land, leaving behind no scraps. Food is nonexistent and drinks are sparse.


[color=#00ff00]3. Residences of the Destitute[/color]
[b]Food Rating: 0
Drink Rating: 1
Includes: Homes of loners, poor people, and nobodies.[/b]

A (small) step up from banditry, these people, mostly unemployed, have very little to their name and leave no room for excess, besides a drink to wash away their sorrows.


[color=#00ff00]4. Workers' Residence[/color]
[b]Food Rating: 0.5
Drink Rating: 1
Includes: Homes of workers or communal buildings.[/b]

Workers are one of the most affected by the famine and live their lives with whatever food their meager wage can afford. They have few room for excess and must take whatever they can and live with it.


[color=#00ff00]4. Farm[/color]
[b]Food Rating: 1
Drink Rating: 1
Includes: Farms[/b]

Growing food for themselves, farmers are able to sustain themselves. However, with the civil war raging on, the blight of the crops, and the needs of the rest of Skyrim, most produce are sold rather than stored.


[color=#00ff00]5. Business Residence[/color]
[b]Food Rating: 1
Drink Rating: 2
Includes: Homes of business owners[/b]

Generating more income than most Skyrim residents, business and shop owners can afford a little extra food and a better selection of drinks.


[color=#00ff00]6. Inn[/color]
[b]Food Rating: 2
Drink Rating: 2
Includes: Inns[/b]

Although having been hit hard by the food shortage, inns have an okay selection of food and beverages on display.


[color=#00ff00]7. Wealthy House[/color]
[b]Food Rating: 2
Drink Rating: 3
Includes: Property of lucrative business owners, thanes, and other very rich people. Temples[/b]

Even with the famine, the wealthy live a comfortable, although, not excess lifestyle


[color=#00ff00]8. Military [/color]
[b]Food Rating: 3
Drink Rating: 3
Includes: Buildings owned by the Stormcloak and Imperial Army (Not including former bandit occupied forts)[/b]

Due to the civil war, the food distribution has been shifted to the military, with soldier combat effectiveness a major concern.


[color=#00ff00]9. Guild[/color]
[b]Food Rating: 3
Drink Rating: 4
Includes: Buildings owned by the Companions, College of Winterhold, etc[/b]

Guilds contain a number of wealthy, well respected, or sneaky individuals who can all pitch in and provide a semi excess lifestyle.


[color=#00ff00]10. Jarl[/color]
[b]Food Rating: 4
Drink Rating: 4
Includes: Thrones and homes of jarls.
[/b]
Jarls are excessive, maybe not as much as before, but compared to everyone else, there are no shortage of food and drink in a jarl's hall.


[color=red][size=150]SKYRIM - FOOD = MORE STABILITY[/size][/color]

-Because

1. Having less things to load
2. ?
3. PROFIT!



[color=#00ff00]Other Features[/color]
[b]-Areas that are abandoned or have no npcs that are of a playeable race have zero food.
-Barrels and sacks have no food (V2), but have a chance to receive salt (V2.1), garlic or wheat (V2.1.1).
-Each inn has different selections of food that it can and cannot sell based on location (V2.1).
-Harvesting crops on farms will net you with either a healthy, edible morsel, or an inedible blighted version that can be used for alchemy (V2.1).
-Set ownership to crops on farms (V2.1).
-Crops disabled in abandoned farms and destitute residences (V2).
-Extra domesticated animals in farms disabled (V2), and the amount of chickens available is dependent on the quantity of chicken nests (V2.1).
-Giant camps won't have mammoth cheese if there are no mammoths (V2).
-Market stalls contain only one of each item (usually) and are losing a bit on item selection.
-Only camps of hunters or soldiers have food (V2).
-Salmons and clams disabled only if near people (V2).
-Streets and outdoor areas near buildings have been picked clean (V2).

[/b]

[color=red][size=100]Wait! What the hell did I just read![/size][/color]

-Basically, Skyrim has too much food/wine lying around, making basic needs mods such as Ineed extremely easy to survive without much effort. This mod disables most of those consumables in areas where there is too many depending on the location, type of items, and quantity of npcs.

Does that help? 




[size=100][color=#6aa84f]Installation[/size][/color]



REQUIRES ALL DLC

-Move the main esp file into the data folder manually or with a mod manager and either wait 10 in game days for all food/wine placements to be reset or start a new game. If you have a mod that allows you to adjust the cell reset time (ex. Deadly Dragons) then use that if you are not starting a new game.



[size=100][color=#6aa84f]Patches[/size] [/color](All Patches in the Optional Files are only compatible with V2.1.2 or above, search the Old Files for pre V2 patches if you are using any LEGACY versions)



[size=5][color=#ff0000]Complete Alchemy and Cooking Overhaul V2 Beta[/color] [/size]
-Adjusted CACO leveled lists to YH standards and incorporated CACO items into YH leveled lists. 
-Disabled most onions in Carlotta's market stall, and added them to her leveled list. 
-Matched Blighted crops' ingredient effect values to match CACO standards. 
[size=5]
[color=#ff0000]Expanded Towns and Cities Complete[/color][/size]
-Applied YH changes to ETAC food and drink distribution.
-Replaced food baskets with normal baskets as well as plates containing static food with normal plates.
-Resolved conflicts between ETAC and YH

(REQUIRES ETAC 1.43 COMPLETE AND ALL ADDONS. DO NOT USE THE NO INNS VERSION)


[color=#ff0000][size=5]Falskaar[/size][/color]
-Applies You Hunger changes to Falskaar.

[color=#000000]
[color=#ff0000][size=5]Moon and Star[/size][/color][/color]
-Applies You Hunger changes to Little Vivec.





[size=100][color=#6aa84f]Load Order and Compatibility[/size][/color]

-This mod should be loaded after your basic needs mod, but as high as you can for maximum compatibility. Since this mod contains cell edits, if you load it after a sound/lighting overhaul mod, it will overwrite the lighting and acoustic space edits made by that mod. For bash patch purposes, the Delev and Relev tags are required. If you play with house mods or city renovation mods (ETac, Dawn of series, JK's overhauls, Realistic Room Rental Enhanced, Skyrim Radioactive), more food and wine will appear since they add more and move existing food which renables them.
If you use Dynamic Things, get the Enhanced Edition which allows you to turn off food distribution.


COMPATIBLE WITH ALL BASIC NEEDS MODS!


My Mods
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50844]Dragons Diversified DLC Patch[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/43967]Enchanting Awakened Skyre Perk Tree Merge[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/46495]SkyTEST Integration Project[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/13428]SkyTEST Integration Project SE[/url]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88642]Wild World[/url]

files.name: You Hunger
files.changelogHtml:
-Removed hanging rabbits, pheasants, dead salmon, and mammoth cheese from abandoned/unpopulated interiors.
-Removed excess amounts of hanging rabbits, pheasants, dead salmon, and mammoth cheese in certain interiors.
-Interiors with either hanging rabbits, pheasants, dead salmon, or mammoth cheese have had their food count decreased in relation to the amount of it in the interior.
-Misc fixes

files.name: You Hunger Realism No DLC Edition
files.changelogHtml:
-Removed 70% of overall current food/drink spawns.
-Added Delev tag to esp.
-Hanging food, salmon, mammoth cheese, and clam removed from abandoned exterior locations.
-More exterior locations are considered abandoned (mostly giant camps).
-Abandoned Prison, Crystaldrift Cave, Dawnstar Sanctuary, and Raldbthor Deep Market are considered abandoned.
-Over 98% of interiors with food and drink spawns are now affected by this mod.
-Carried over fixes from USKP into newly affected interiors and exteriors.

files.name: You Hunger Realism Dawnguard Edition
files.changelogHtml:
-Edited Dawnguard and Dragonborn interiors and exteriors
-Edited 2 Dragonborn leveled lists (DLC2FoodLeek, DLC2FoodNew)
-Carried over UDBP fixes to interiors.
-Added 4 different editions (No DLC, Dragonborn, Dawnguard, and Legendary)

-One new edition, Complete Edition. (combines legendary, falskaar, and wyrmstooth).
-Two optional files for Falskaar and Wyrmstooth for use with the other editions (besides Complete).

files.name: You Hunger
files.changelogHtml:
-Mod completely redone from scratch
-Added Hearthfire support.
-Falskaar and Wyrmstooth dropped from latest version (will become seperate patches).
-Non disabled foods/drinks are located in more logical and harder to reach places compared to previous versions
-The amount of disabled food and drink is now based on location (based on wealth) with variations based on population and item type.
-Most food and drinks not pinned down to a market stall in exterior locations are now disabled.
-Market stalls aren't doing so well either.
-Re enabled salmon and mammoth cheese in areas that didn't make any sense being disabled.
-About 83% of crops disabled (leek, cabbage, potato, gourd, wheat, ash yam.
-Food types available for placed food is now based on location.
-Extensive leveled list changes. Merchants sell only what you see and food in barrels and sacks are nonexistant.
-Domesticated animals disabled except one of each type in an area. All domesticated animals disabled in specific areas.

files.name: You Hunger V2.1
files.changelogHtml:
-Disabled unnecessary plates and other clutter on top of tables next to furniture that can be sat on based on population.
-Added a chance to get salt in leveled lists for barrels, sacks, etc. Merchants who sell meat also sell salt.
-Inns now have a larger quantity of stock. Each inn has different selections of food based on location.
-Increased vendor stock quantity.
-Misc changes to leveled lists.
-Misc changes in available foods and drinks in some places.
-Greatly buffed food and drink availability in guardhouses/barracks.
-Increased drink availability in forts.
-Disabled or re-enabled crop, chicken, and chicken nest spawns in some places.
-Increased food availability in workers' houses with more than one person.
-Re-enabled crops on farms and mills.
-Receive regular crops or blighted versions when harvesting them.
-Set ownership to all crops on farms.

files.name: You Hunger V2.1.1
files.changelogHtml:
-Added Hearthfire foods to inn leveled lists.
-Added missing ingredients to MerchantHonningbrewPostChest.
-Added more variety to barrel and sack loot.
-Adjusted Inn and Vendor item distribution
-Completely removed sacks of flour from barrels and sacks.
-Fixed physical foods and drinks in inns not being buyable.

files.name: You Hunger V2.1.2
files.changelogHtml:
-Adjusted salt and garlic distribution for vendors and inns.
-Fixed Frostfruit and Windpeak inn items on the counter not being buyable.
-Fixed drink quantity in Solitude inn.
-Misc changes for CACO support

Added CACO patch for V2 Beta.
-Adjusted CACO leveled lists to YH standards and incorporated CACO items into YH leveled lists.
-Disabled most onions in Carlotta's market stall, and added them to her leveled list.
-Matched Blighted crops' ingredient effect values to match CACO standards.

-The amount of disabled food and drink is now based on location (based on wealth) with variations based on population and item type.
-Most food and drinks not pinned down to a market stall in exterior locations are now disabled.
-Market stalls aren't doing so well either.
-Re enabled salmon and mammoth cheese in areas that didn't make any sense being disabled.
-About 83% of crops disabled (leek, cabbage, potato, gourd, wheat, ash yam.
-Food types available for placed food is now based on location.
-Extensive leveled list changes. Merchants sell only what you see and food in barrels and sacks are nonexistant.
-Domesticated animals disabled except one of each type in an area. All domesticated animals disabled in specific areas.

files.name: You Hunger 2.1.7
files.changelogHtml:
-Added ownership for chicken nests
-Changed blighted leek effects
-Switched missing crop in Darkwater Crossing to YH variant
